feed.title: SAP Community - SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
feed.subtitle: SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: OnSave Business Rule for dependents
entry.content:
Hi All,

I would like to ask you the question regarding the onSave business rule used for the validation of the date of birth for the dependents. My client asked to enable the validation that if the DOB of a new joiner in onboarding is on or before the DOB of a dependent set to father or mother, then the error message should display.

I achieved this with the simple business rule assigned to personRelationshipInfo as onSave. The rule works when the condition is met, it even works when the data is corrected (i.e. DOB is corrected, relationship type is changed from father/mother to something else) - and this is where the issue occurs. With that the onboarding process will get stacked. I tried to modify the rule by following the suggestion from this KBA, but I am unable to use previous value since Employee Information as the base object. Using Employee Information Model causes that the rule does not work (the error does not trigger); same happens when I use dependents model.

What I tried as the alternative is to create the onChange rule which would remove the DOB of a dependent. I managed to trigger this rule, but only when the relationship type is changed (which is not ideal, because a new joiner will not be changing the relationship type in this case, rather the DOB). The problem is the rule removes only the current value, and not the old value, hence the error still displays when you reach the end of the data collection step.

Alternatively I changed the severity of the message to warning, but the warning will still display even after correcting the data, which will not block the onb process, but will be confusing for the end user.

Does anyone knows how to workaround this? I spent way too much time on this and could not find the solution.

I attached the screen shots of both rules for your reference.

Regards,

Piotr Retecki

entry.title: Document Generation configuration
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I’ve configured several documents in SuccessFactors for generation. However, I’m facing a challenge — I need to include both the employee’s current location and their previous location in some of these documents.

Has anyone already implemented this type of configuration?
Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Job Classification Help
entry.content:
Hi all,

First, I'll share that we are currently unable to implement job profile builder and need help with a solution.

We have a need to create job classifications that could have a variety of job titles. 

For example, the Job Classification Machine Operator could have one of the following job titles on the position and employee profile, Machine Operator I, Machine Operator II or Machine Operator III.   

I need help understanding how to control what job titles align with a job classification.  I can't have a Production Operator I aligned with the Machine Operator job classification.

entry.title: How to download standard Business rules in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello SuccessFactors Experts,

I’m currently unable to view the standard business rules within the Configure Business Rules section. Specifically, I’m trying to access the SFCC Pay Range_onLoad rule.

Could you please confirm:

  • Should standard business rules like this be visible by default?
  • Is there a separate step required to download or import them?

Appreciate your guidance!

Best regards,
Vijay Gopu

entry.title: Pay Component Rate for Time Account Payout
entry.content:
I have a Time Account set up to allow Payout. When I create the payout, the rate is different than the employee's hourly pay. Can someone help me understand how the standard rate is calculated? I have looked at the Pay Scale Level and it matches the employee's hourly pay, but different than the Rate per Hour that is displayed in Time Account Payout screen with Standard Rate selected.

Thank you,

Cindy

entry.title: Workflow Approval/Notification Time Off Request
entry.content:
I have a group of employees who currently have workflow set to notification only (no approval) for Time Off Request. There is one subset of those employees that they now want to require approval. My question is whether it is possible/recommended to do those separate workflows within the same Time Type. Currently, the workflow rule is just setting the workflow that is attached to the Time Type. I am thinking that I will have to create a new Time Type (and Time Profile for this group. 

I have not done a lot with workflow so I wanted to ask the experts before I start creating a new Time Profile.

Thank you,

Cindy

entry.title: 2H 2025- After enabling the shell bar users are unable to Run / Edit Story reports
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We've encountered an issue after enabling the Shell Bar in the 2H 2025 release where users are unable to Run or Edit Story Reports.

When attempting to interact with the reports, users are facing an unexpected behavior preventing access to the story report functionality.

 Details:

  • Release Affected: 2H 2025

  • Feature Involved: Shell Bar (Enabled)

  • Symptom: Inability to Run or Edit existing Story Reports.

Current Workaround:

The temporary workaround is to disable the Shell Bar. This restores the ability to run and edit Story Reports.

  1. company system and logo settings.

  2. Toggle off the Shell Bar feature.

  3. Clear browser cache and test the Story Reports again.

Has anyone else experienced this?

Please share if you have encountered this specific issue and if the workaround solved it for you, or if you've found an alternative solution. We're tracking this and hope for a fix soon.

Looking forward to your insights!

entry.title: Bank Information attachment
entry.content: Bank information attachments aren’t replicating from Employee Central (EC) to Recruiting Management (RCM) during the rehire process. Is it possible to map this field for replication? Or alternatively, can we create a business rule to either hide the field or make it non-mandatory in RCM, while keeping it mandatory in Onboarding (ONB) and EC?

entry.title: Locate the next Employee with GG in hierarchy
entry.content:
Hi, currently we use an MDF and a rule to display an employees hierarchy. 

This module shows all your managers in the chain until the CEO. 

I'm looking for ways to locate the next employee in line with a certain grade, and add it to the MDF with an additional field. 

For example, if you are Grade 20 I would like to locate the next Grade 25 in line and add this value to my existing mdf.

Looking for logical ideas to approach this. 

In my case there are two decisions bases on Grades 0-24 should look for next Grade 25 in the hierarchy.

Grades 25 and above should look for the next highest grade in the hierarchy. Typically their own manager.

entry.title: Create a report in SAP SuccessFactors Employee central for Individual Contributor
entry.content:
Hello,

We want to create a report in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central which provides data of Employees who are Individual Contributors i.e. do not have any direct reportees or are the last node in hierarchy.

We have created a report to fetch the entire hierarchy of a selected Manager but are not able to fetch the last employee of the hierarchy via reporting. 

Looking for some suggestions.

Regards,

Hinal Deriya

entry.title: Leave accrual based on working days i previous year
entry.content:
Hi @Volker_Ruof / @StephanieCR  / experts / product owners,

We are busy exploring a configuration scenario where the annual leave entitlement is determined by the number of working days in the previous year.

A working day is defined as:

  • A normal working day

  • Working on a non-working day

  • More than 4 hours of overtime booked in a day

  • Absence due to a work accident, strike, etc.
    (There are a few other basic conditions, but these are the main ones.)

The working day checks have been achieved using time valuations, which add to a counter in a time collector. This correctly calculates the number of working days.

The accrual period and account validity are based on the employee’s hire date. For example, the number of working days from 1 June 2024 to 31 May 2025 determines the entitlement for 1 June 2025.

This would have been straightforward if all employees shared the same accrual period, as we could use a flexible-period time collector. However, because the period differs per employee (based on hire date), this becomes more complex.

We are currently considering two possible approaches and would appreciate your feedback or alternative suggestions:

Scenario 1:
Leverage a workaround within the decision or calculation rule (details can be shared privately with product owners or experts) to manipulate or assign values to the time valuation/time type group, thereby determining working days for the relevant annual period.

Scenario 2:
Use a daily time collector that writes to a custom object. The accrual rule would then read the value from this custom object, populated via an onSave rule in the timesheet or time type groups.
The downside is potential performance issues, and it would not automatically capture retrospective timesheet changes unless the timesheet is re-saved.

Would love to hear your thoughts, feedback or alternative approaches.

Thank you!

 

SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking

entry.title: How to reference child object in another custom MDF object
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I noticed an error message when I try to reference child object in another custom MDF object

You have used object cust_ChildObject as the valid value source for field cust_FieldName. The effective dating of object cust_ChildObject is set to “From Parent”. This will lead to errors in accessing quickcards and many other issues. Please remove the field reference.

Therefore, is there another way to reference the child object from the parent object in another custom MDF object? Basically getting the information of the child object of another parent object.

Thank you.

entry.title: Want to learn My Integration - SAP SF EC. Please suggest some link or documentation.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m interested in learning about SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (EC) Integration — specifically, how integrations are structured and implemented (e.g., API, CPI, Integration Center, etc.).

Could anyone please suggest official documentation, learning materials, or community tutorials that would help me get started?
Any practical examples or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Best Practices for employees on extended notice periods
entry.content:
What is the common practice among companies that have offices in Europe, where employees are on extended notice periods due to legal requirements?

Specifically, in situations where companies are unable to deactivate their profiles in internal systems, is it standard to restrict or deactivate their access to company systems during this period?

entry.title: How to identify all integrations in SuccessFactors that use SFAPI / SOAP?
entry.content:
Hi Experts

Please let me know how I can identify all integrations in SuccessFactors that use SFAPI / SOAP.

I have heard that SAP is deprecating SFAPI / SOAP based integration methods in SuccessFactors.

To switch to new integration methods, I first need to know all the integrations currently running in SuccessFactors that use SFAPI / SOAP.

Thank you

Arul

entry.title: Absence Reporting Success Factors Across Countries with Role-Based Access (via Story)
entry.content:
Hello, we are looking for a reporting solution within SuccessFactors that allows us to easily analyze employee absences. Ideally, we would like to configure the report so that it is accessible to all countries, while ensuring that each user can only view data relevant to their own country based on permission settings.

Is there a recommended approach or best practice to achieve this setup? Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!
